result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Fumbanks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to any other sentence; AS TO BOTH COUNTS; with 181 days credit

miscConds.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If revoked the court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's at an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With Huber; Court stayed commencement to 09-30-2016 by 5pm

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order for Funeral Pass signed and filed.

Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in court with attorney Brian Kinstler.  Daniel Murphy for Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 181 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 181 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS.

Court stays the sentences in count 1 and 2 and places the defendant on PROBATION for  3 YEARS. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 MONTHS condition time with Huber. Court stayed commencement to 9-30-2016 by 5 pm.  
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
- If revoked the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections at an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in court with attorney Brian Kinstler.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 07/25/2016 is vacated.  As to Counts 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in court with attorney Brian Kinstler.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

For reasons stated on the record, the Court grants the Defense motion to adjourn final pre-trial and jury trial.  Jury trial date of 04/11/2016 is vacated.  Any motions are due 05/20/2016.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in court with attorney Brian Kinstler.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Kinstler for attorney Krejci.

Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Zach Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense attorney has submitted a motion to withdraw as counsel.  The defendant wishes to retain a private attorney.  Court DENIES defense motion at this time, however will accept a substitute of attorney at the next court date.  If defendant has not hired anyone by the next court date the final pre-trial and jury trial will continue.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Motion to withdraw as counsel received and filed.

Case in court for status of counsel, however State Public Defender's office did not appoint new counsel.  Case adjourned but remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Attorney Washington informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel and motion hearing in Branch 22 on 11/16/2015 at 1:30pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw received and filed.  Plea and sentencing date of 11/06/2015 at 8:30am is converted to a motion hearing date.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Antonio Fumbanks in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
